715 PYLE DR,
KINGSFORD, MI, 49802-4456
Re: License #: CN220269295
Dear Ms. Hellman:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
January 11, 2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact Jessica VandenHeuvel, Area Manager, at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Doug Turrill, Licensing Consultant
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
 R 400.12311 Foster parent/agency agreement. The agency documented that the
foster parent was provided the agreement, and the worker signed the agreement
however foster parent signatures should be added to the document and
signatures obtained yearly at interim and renewal inspections.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• Consultation was not requested or provided at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF PERIOD UNDER REVIEW
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plan (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with the CAP is as follows. The agency
submitted an approved corrective action plan on February 8, 2023, in response to
a violation of R 400.12212 Personnel Records, which was established during the
renewal inspection completed on January 18, 2023. The current interim inspection
established that central registry clearances were completed by January 31, 2023.
2

Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment was submitted and reviewed. The
assessment addressed the corrective action taken to remedy the rule violation
established during the 2023 renewal inspection. The agency did not identify any
barriers to compliance to the rules during the licensing period.
Financial Overview
Financial documents were reviewed and no concerns were noted.
Staff Interviews
The program supervisor reported the agency recently licensed three foster homes
and the agency is excited about this progress. The licensing worker reported liking
working for the agency and was excited that two homes have been licensed for
the agency.
Description of Agency Walk Through
CHRI documents were stored securely. The agency is located in a modern
building with adequate office space.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency is non-contracted.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their
regular license.
January 29, 2024
________________________________________
Douglas W Turrill Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
February 1, 2024
